intro: Aerva artemisioides, commonly known as Indian fennel, is a flowering plant native to regions of Asia, including India and China. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties. Aerva artemisioides thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
